body: Haven't yet tested the performance changes on a large cluster and this needs some additional tests.

There's a couple additional optimizations that could be done as well:
- Deferring updates for a couple of seconds so that we lower the overall number of ZK reads/stat calls
- Checking the instance config stats on external view change prior to fetching them

Since the API is on a per field basis, ideally I would like to error out when the field added is not correct. But then I agree that it makes sense to call validate() and add anything we want in there. I will make the change

Travis build is broken for now, the fix for the build is in #802. I'll merge this once the build looks good.
Lgtm

Interface consistency and control.

With helix weadmin, the paths and responses will look inconsistent from say
reading table config (we can read that also from helix webadmin). This way,
we hide exact cluster path names and how the resources are named
(_realtime/_offline part).

We can control the response layout and provide more information if needed.

Yes, there's a fair bit of logging on a per-query basis (IIRC last time I ran it it was 3-4 log lines per query, which unfortunately makes the JMH output unreadable) which interferes with performance measurements. For performance measurements, we should whitelist logging as opposed to having everything logging to the console imho.
we should probably have this feature on a per function basis

## [Current coverage](https://codecov.io/gh/linkedin/pinot/pull/823?src=pr) is 64.23% (diff: 66.66%)

> No coverage report found for **master** at 1252b86.
> 
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io?src=pr). Last update [1252b86...f3fe6b9](https://codecov.io/gh/linkedin/pinot/compare/1252b864eb9d3f145519f4701fb21008266ba74e...f3fe6b93469a81cb492721259494f6241a47e475?src=pr)
added tests for more tables and segments

Strange. Clients generally shouldn't be performance bottlenecks. Did you
consider fixing the logging in the client instead of blanket change of log
level ?

We use this for local perf benchmark drivers and that misses info about
services startup. Those don't show logs on queries so this may be an issue
in the performance driver you are using.

-Adwait

Realtimesegments also use the same SegmentMetadataImpl class right ?  So, there shouldn't be a difference
realtime segments subclass SegmentMetadataImpl, and some methods are overridden to throw exception. So, adding a test will future-proof this.
I stand corrected, this is not an inherited class. Go for it.
Do you mean the order or elements inside the multi-value? Currently Pinot does not retain order of elements inside multi-value.
